decision_conditions:
The development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development hereby permitted shall not proceed beyond superstructure level until samples and full particulars of the proposed external materials, including render, window, door, roof and rainwater goods materials, have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing.


The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved which shall be implemented in full prior to the first occupation/use of the development and retained in perpetuity.



REASON: To ensure a satisfactory form of development and in the interests of the visual amenity of the host building and the area.

The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until a green / brown roof, with a minimum substrate depth of 80mm, has been installed on the retained ground floor roof areas of the building.


The living roof shall be maintained in accordance with the manufacturer's recommendations.


REASON: To improve the energy efficiency of the building and to promote biodiversity at the site.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, as amended, or any order modifying or replacing that order whether in whole or in part, the extension hereby permitted shall only be used for a purpose falling within Use Class E(g) [for—

(i) an office to carry out any operational or administrative functions,

(ii) the research and development of products or processes, or

(iii) any industrial process,

being a use, which can be carried out in any residential area without detriment to the amenity of that area by reason of noise, vibration, smell, fumes, smoke, soot, ash, dust or grit.] of Part A of Schedule 2 to that Order and for no other purpose within Use Class E of that Order.


REASON: Other general commercial uses within Use Class E are considered to be inappropriate for the site for amenity and transport reasons.
description: Erection of first floor extension and refurbishment of existing building with external wall insulation and double-glazed windows; erection of external staircase; provision of new employment unit.
